channel.title: Saturate Audio Output
channel.description: Could someone clarify the "Saturate Audio Output" option available in a patcher's settings? I didn't find much more documentation beyond the Axoloti User Guide: [quote="thetechnobear, post:1, topic:50"] saturate audio - is the the audio output from this patch saturated [/quote] Thanks.

item.title: Saturate Audio Output
item.dc:creator: @jfcharles Jean-Francois Charles
item.description:
@jfcharles wrote:

Thanks for the clarification, that makes sense. I'll try to understand which of the settings make sense to only the top level patch, and which ones work for subpatches (depending on the mode).

Read full topic

item.title: Saturate Audio Output
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

Saturate is only used on the top level patch, not subpatches. (we use the same dialog for main patch and subpatches)

generally within axoloti the audio processing the audio signal is done at 28 bits. this is then 'saturated' at the root level to 32 bits. normally this is fine, unless you are already saturating your signal due to your patching/processing.

Read full topic

item.title: Saturate Audio Output
item.dc:creator: @jfcharles Jean-Francois Charles
item.description:
@jfcharles wrote:

OK, as far as I can tell, the "Saturate Audio Output" has no effect in Polyphonic mode. The signals coming from each voice are just summed, in both cases.
I'd love to be wrong, that would mean I would come closer to understand this option, so thanks for any pointer in the right direction!

Read full topic

item.title: Saturate Audio Output
item.dc:creator: @jfcharles Jean-Francois Charles
item.description:
@jfcharles wrote:

Could someone clarify the "Saturate Audio Output" option available in a patcher's settings?
I didn't find much more documentation beyond the Axoloti User Guide:

Axoloti User Guide

saturate audio - is the the audio output from this patch saturated

Thanks.

Read full topic
